getting_started_intro: EPUB Online Viewer lets you read EPUB ebooks directly in your browser. You don’t need to create an account or install any app. This guide walks you through uploading your first book, using your library, and reading with the built-in reader.
getting_started_upload_body: On the home page you’ll see an upload area. Drag and drop an .epub file onto it, or click to browse and select a file from your computer or device. Only .epub files are accepted. Once you drop or select a file, the app will add it to your library and open the reader so you can start reading right away. If you upload the same book again later, it will open directly in the reader.
getting_started_library_body: All books you upload appear in “Your library” on the home page. Each book shows its cover (if available) and title. Click a book to open it in the reader and continue from where you left off. You can remove a book from the library using the delete button that appears when you hover over the book. Your library is stored on this device only; it is not synced to the cloud or other devices.
getting_started_reader_body: Inside the reader you can move between chapters using the table of contents, use previous and next to move through the book, and switch to full-screen mode for a distraction-free view. You can change font size, choose a font (including serif options), and switch between light and dark theme. Your reading position is saved automatically, so when you return to the same book you’ll continue from the same page.
getting_started_tip_1: Use the table of contents to jump to any chapter instead of paging through.
getting_started_tip_2: Full-screen mode hides the toolbar for a cleaner reading experience.
getting_started_tip_3: Your library stays on this device. To read the same book on another device, upload the same .epub file there.
getting_started_outro: That’s all you need to get started. Open EPUB Online Viewer, upload an EPUB, and start reading. No sign-up, no payment, and your books stay on your device.

seo_what_is_epub_title: What is EPUB? – Ebook Format Explained | EPUB Online Viewer
seo_what_is_epub_description: Learn what EPUB is: the open standard for ebooks, how it works, and why it’s used by publishers and readers worldwide. Read EPUB files online in your browser with EPUB Online Viewer.
seo_what_is_epub_keywords: what is epub, epub format, ebook format, open epub, read epub online
what_is_epub_intro: EPUB is an open, free standard for ebooks. It is widely used by publishers, libraries, and readers. Files in EPUB format usually have the .epub extension and can be read on many devices and apps, including in your browser with EPUB Online Viewer.
what_is_epub_what_body: EPUB stands for “electronic publication.” It is a format for ebooks defined by the International Digital Publishing Forum (IDPF), now part of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). Unlike some proprietary formats, EPUB is based on open web standards such as HTML and CSS, so it can be used by anyone and is supported by a large ecosystem of reading devices and software.
what_is_epub_how_body: An EPUB file is essentially a package of web-style content. Inside the file you’ll find HTML for the text, CSS for styling, images, and metadata that describe the book (title, author, language, etc.). The structure follows a standard so that any compliant reader can open and display the book correctly. Most EPUBs are reflowable: text adapts to screen size and font settings, which makes them ideal for reading on different devices.
what_is_epub_versions_body: EPUB 2 is an older, very widely supported version. EPUB 3 is the current standard and adds better support for languages, embedded fonts, and richer layout. EPUB Online Viewer supports both EPUB 2 and EPUB 3 files, so you can read most .epub books you obtain from stores, libraries, or other sources.
what_is_epub_why_body: Reading EPUB in the browser means you don’t need to install a dedicated app. You can start as soon as you have a .epub file: upload it, and read. Your book stays on your device, and you get a full-screen reader with table of contents, font and theme options, and saved position. EPUB Online Viewer is built for that—simple, private, and free.
what_is_epub_benefits_body: EPUB is reflowable: text adapts to screen size and font settings, so the same book reads well on a phone, tablet, or desktop. It supports multiple languages, embedded fonts, and rich structure (chapters, sections, notes). Because it’s an open standard, many reading apps and devices support it, and you’re not locked into a single vendor. Libraries and publishers often distribute ebooks in EPUB for these reasons.
what_is_epub_where_body: You can get .epub files from online bookstores, public libraries (via apps like Libby or Overdrive), free repositories like Project Gutenberg, or publishers’ websites. Once you have an .epub file, you can read it in EPUB Online Viewer: upload it on the home page, and it’s added to your library. No account or installation required.
what_is_epub_summary_body: EPUB is the open standard for ebooks. Files use the .epub extension and contain HTML, CSS, and metadata. EPUB 2 and EPUB 3 are both widely used. You can read EPUBs in many apps and devices, including in your browser with EPUB Online Viewer—upload a file, and start reading with a full-screen reader, table of contents, and your choice of font and theme.
seo_about_title: About Us – EPUB Online Viewer | Free EPUB Reader Online
seo_about_description: About EPUB Online Viewer: a free web app for reading EPUB ebooks in your browser. No account, no server storage—your books stay on your device.
seo_about_keywords: about epub online viewer, epub reader about, free epub viewer
about_intro: EPUB Online Viewer is a free web application that lets you read EPUB ebooks directly in your browser. We built it for people who want a simple, private way to read ebooks online—without installing apps or creating accounts.
about_mission_body: We want reading EPUBs to be as easy as opening a website. You upload a book, it’s saved in your browser on your device, and you read it in a clean, full-screen reader with table of contents, font and theme options, and automatic position saving. We don’t store your books on our servers and we don’t require an account. Your reading stays on your device and under your control.
about_how_body: When you upload an .epub file, the app processes it in your browser and stores it locally. When you open a book, the reader loads the content from that local storage and displays it. All of this happens on your device; we don’t receive or host your book files. The app supports standard EPUB 2 and EPUB 3 and works on desktop and mobile browsers.
about_who_body: We built EPUB Online Viewer for anyone who reads ebooks: students with course materials, travelers with a few books on their device, book lovers building a digital library, or anyone who wants a simple, private way to read EPUBs in the browser. No app store, no account, no subscription—just open the site, upload a book, and read.
about_values_body: We care about privacy: your books stay on your device and we don’t store or read them. We care about simplicity: no sign-up, no installation, no learning curve. We care about openness: EPUB is an open standard, and our app works in any modern browser. We want reading online to feel as good as reading on a dedicated e-reader.
about_contact: If you have questions or feedback, you can reach us through the Contact page.

contact_other_body: We do not offer phone or live chat support. For bug reports or feature suggestions, please include as much detail as you can (browser, device, and what went wrong) so we can look into it.

seo_privacy_description: Privacy policy for EPUB Online Viewer. We do not store your books on our servers. Your EPUB files stay on your device. Learn how we handle data.
seo_privacy_keywords: epub viewer privacy, epub reader privacy policy, read epub privacy
privacy_intro: This privacy policy explains how EPUB Online Viewer (“we”, “the app”) handles information when you use the service. We are committed to protecting your privacy. The key point: we do not store your books or reading content on our servers. Your EPUB files and your reading activity remain on your device. This page describes in detail what data we do and do not collect, how we use it, and what you can expect when you use the app.
privacy_books_body: When you upload an EPUB file, it is processed and stored only in your browser on your device (using local storage such as the browser’s standard storage mechanisms). We do not upload, receive, or store the contents of your books on our servers. Your library, reading position, and any data derived from your books remain on your device. We cannot access, read, or share your books.
privacy_usage_body: When you visit the site, the server may receive standard technical information such as your IP address, browser type, and the pages you request. This is common for any website and may be used for operation, security, and analytics (e.g. to understand how the site is used). We do not link this to your identity or your reading content. We do not require you to create an account or provide personal details to read books.
privacy_cookies_body: The app may use local storage in your browser to save your library, reading positions, and preferences (such as theme or language). This data stays on your device. We may use minimal cookies or similar technology for essential operation or analytics; we do not use them to track you across other sites or to access your books.
privacy_third_body: We may use third-party services (e.g. hosting, analytics). Those services have their own privacy policies. We do not give them your book content or your reading history. Any data they receive is limited to what is normally collected by such services (e.g. page views, general usage).
privacy_changes_body: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. The current version will always be on this page. Continued use of the service after changes means you accept the updated policy.
privacy_contact_body: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us through the Contact page.
